Enter place to search near the High Line

"CENTRAL PARK. Okay everyone knows this one but it’s a good one filled with beautiful and sometimes unknown amazement and entertainment. Look out for theboat pond, Shakespeare's Garden, The Central Park Zoo or just bring a blanket and layouton one of the many lawn areas."

"SMORGASBURG. Brooklyn’s flea and food market is Saturdays in Williamsburg and Sundays at Prospect Park. Amazing food served from a large selection oftrucks at the edge of the river(Saturday) and in the park(Sundays). Great outdoorsy peoplewatching and food! Bring something to sit on and enjoy the views and sunshine for a day."
SHAKESPEARE IN THE PARKING LOT. Come early for a seat.Bring a seat. Sit on a blanket. Enjoy live Shakespeare performances, FREE!
THE BEACH. What!? Beach in the city?? Yep, and you have a few choices with different activities at each one. Brighton is simple close and the onlytravel cost is the train.

THE HIGH LINE. Through collaborative efforts in architecture and plant design an abandoned elevated train line has been transformed into a paradise to spend a day reading, walking, eating or people watching. Random art exhibits keep you wondering what is next.
SUPPLIES: Water, hat, sunglasses, towel, sunscreen and snacks.
SUPPLIES: Blanket or chair to sit on. (If you are earlyenough there is some seating available).
SUPPLIES: Water, money for food, (blanket for sitting is optional).
SUPPLIES: Beverages, games, blanket and food.
SUPPLIES: Beverage and walking shoes. Maybe a book if you would like to lounge.
GETTING THERE: From Manhattan or Brooklyn take the B-train to the Brighton Beach stop. Walk South 1 block.
GETTING THERE: 114 Norfolk Street. F,M-train to Delanceywalk 1 block east then north .5 blocks.
GETTING THERE(Saturdays): From Manhattan L-train towardsCanarsie-Rockaway PKWY and get off at the Bedford Avenue Station. Walk west 3.5 blocks.
GETTING THERE(Sundays): Take the Q,B-train toProspect Park Subway Station. Walk directly east into the park toward Breeze Hill. It is alittle less than half way across.
GETTING THERE: Take the A,B,C-train to 81st street Manhattanthen cross the street to the east. Or, take the 4,5,6-train to 77th or 86 the and walk eastfor 3 blocks.
GETTING THERE: Take the C-train to 14th Street walk west to Washnigton Street and walk up the staircase on the south sidewalk.
